hypothesis_content.title: Liquidation Cascade Reversal Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: A sharp, high-volume price move (>4% in 1 hour) that coincides with a spike in estimated liquidations (> $200M in 1H for the entire market) will be partially reversed within the next 6 hours as the forced selling/long squeeze exhausts itself. The entry is triggered when the 15-minute RSI(14) reaches an extreme (>85 for up move / <15 for down move) during the liquidation hour, and then exits that extreme zone (crosses below 80 or above 20).
hypothesis_content.rationale: Liquidation cascades are self-reinforcing but transient. They create an 'air pocket' in price as stop-losses and leveraged positions are flushed. Once the forced selling/buying subsides, price often experiences a partial reversion as natural liquidity and value-based buyers/sellers re-enter, amplifying the counter-trend move.
entry_conditions: BTC 1H absolute return > 4% on volume > 120% of 20-period average.
During the high-volatility hour, BTC 15m RSI(14) reaches >85 (for up move) or <15 (for down move), then the next 15m candle closes with RSI crossing back below 80 or above 20.

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 38.2% of the initial 1H catalyst move.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price extends beyond the 1H catalyst move by an additional 50% (e.g., if catalyst move was -5%, stop at -7.5% from pre-catalyst price).

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The mean retracement of the initial 1H move within 6 hours is less than 20% across qualifying events, indicating the momentum continues more often than it reverses.
